dct_description_sm: This collection of  Geospatial Data from the East View Global Census Archive presents Cuba's 2012 census in GIS-friendly formats including File Geodatabase, Shapefiles, documentation, and metadata. It is restricted to use by UWM Students, Faculty, and Staff for scholarly and academic uses.

[Official population and housing data for Cuba from the 2012 census. This census is provided at the Municipality administrative level (ADM2) and includes 158 polygons with 464 attribute variables. Attribute descriptions retain Spanish language names and unique identifier codes. All variable names were translated from the Spanish language. Field name prefixes, originally written with coded titles, were renamed to create unique names across the geodatabase (e.g. Original variable of “F1_Male” was updated to D001 and given the alias “Sex: Male [F1_Male]”, the letter D was given as it relates to the Demographic theme table. D = Demographic, E = Economic, H = Housing, M = Migration, S = Social). All variables from the original data were reviewed for completeness and organized into their relevant themes of Demographic, Economic, Housing, Migration and Social. The geodatabase was built to hold these specific tables with all geographic names and codes represented as text fields and census data represented as doubles or long integers. Automated tools were run to apply aliases in the format “English translation field description[Spanish language field description]”. Vector data was analyzed for accuracy and compared with national boundaries.]
gbl_displayNote_sm: Warning: Restricted to UW-Milwaukee Academic Use only. UWM login required for download.
schema_provider_s: American Geographical Society Library – UWM Libraries
